clue.en: A wide, flat receptacle used around the house, especially for cooking.

(usually uncountable) A form of football in which players can hold or kick an ovoid ball. The ball cannot be handled forwards and points are scored by touching the ball to the ground in the area past their opponent’s territory or kicking the ball between goalposts and over a crossbar.
A female deer; also used of similar animals such as antelope, (less commonly goat as nanny is also used).
A unit of weight equal to 16 ounces (about 453 grams); also, the basic monetary unit of the UK.
An aristocrat; one of aristocratic blood.
The process by which something is dried.

The position of a person or team in a tournament or competition who draws no opponent in a particular round so advances to the next round unopposed, or is awarded points for a win in a league table; also the phantom opponent of such a person or team.
